doses are much higher than CT alone.

--- Page 745 ---
731
Radiology
Fig 16.10 The Hounsﬁ eld scale.
Courtesy of Dr T Turmezei.
Fig 16.13 Surface rendered 3D CT 
reconstruction of the pelvis. The pos-
terior aspect of the right acetabulum 
is fractured. The right femur has been 
digitally removed for better viewing.
Courtesy of Norwich Radiology Dept.
Fig 16.14 Cerebral perfusion CT show-
ing ischaemia around the Sylvian ﬁ s-
sure (arrow).
Courtesy of Dr C Cousens.
Fig 16.11 Axial high-resolution CT 
chest on a lung window algorithm; 
note solitary lesion in the right lung 
(in this case, from GPA). 
Courtesy of Norwich Radiology Dept.
Fig 16.12 Axial CT of the abdomen 
after IV contrast (arterial phase). The 
tortuous splenic artery is enhanced 
(arrow)—so is the aorta, but not the 
inferior vena cava (compare to water in 
the stomach).
Courtesy of Norwich Radiology Dept.
